title: Dutch Tempeh traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tempeh 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry aubergine and peas with ras el hanout 17 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Peas & Peppers Spaghetti with Tuna (canned)
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss peas and peppers with half the almonds, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season tuna (canned) and place on the tray. Roast for 30 min, turning once.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

swaps: Swap Pork for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Carrots & Cherry tomatoes Sourdough bread with Lean beef mince
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss carrots and cherry tomatoes with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season lean beef mince and place on the tray. Roast for 33 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Lean for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Salmon fillet Smoked paprika + cumin plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook salmon fillet 3–4 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry spinach and cherry tomatoes with smoked paprika + cumin 33 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Salmon for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Scottish Black beans with Couscous & Peppers
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.
Toss peppers and onion with half the tahini, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season black beans and place on the tray. Air-fry for 51 min, turning once.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Lentils Smoked paprika + cumin bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.

Cook lentils 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry asparagus and peppers with smoked paprika + cumin 20 min; season.

Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.

title: Welsh Chickpeas traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.

Season chickpeas and place on the tray. Air-fry for 39 min, turning once.
